text: <a href="../1-Chronicles-5-1/" title="1 Chronicles 5:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Now the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel, (for he *was* the firstborn; but, forasmuch as he defiled his father's bed, his birthright was given unto the sons of Joseph the son of Israel: and the genealogy is not to be reckoned after the birthright.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-2/" title="1 Chronicles 5:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 For Judah prevailed above his brethren, and of him *came* the chief ruler; but the birthright *was* Joseph's:)

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-3/" title="1 Chronicles 5:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 The sons, *I say*, of Reuben the firstborn of Israel *were*, Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-4/" title="1 Chronicles 5:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 The sons of Joel; Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-5/" title="1 Chronicles 5:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Micah his son, Reaia his son, Baal his son,

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-6/" title="1 Chronicles 5:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Beerah his son, whom Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria carried away *captive*: he *was* prince of the Reubenites.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-7/" title="1 Chronicles 5:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned, *were* the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-8/" title="1 Chronicles 5:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, even unto Nebo and Baalmeon:

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-9/" title="1 Chronicles 5:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 And eastward he inhabited unto the entering in of the wilderness from the river Euphrates: because their cattle were multiplied in the land of Gilead.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-10/" title="1 Chronicles 5:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 And in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagarites, who fell by their hand: and they dwelt in their tents throughout all the east *land* of Gilead.
<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-11/" title="1 Chronicles 5:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And the children of Gad dwelt over against them, in the land of Bashan unto Salchah:
<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-12/" title="1 Chronicles 5:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Joel the chief, and Shapham the next, and Jaanai, and Shaphat in Bashan.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-13/" title="1 Chronicles 5:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 And their brethren of the house of their fathers *were*, Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jachan, and Zia, and Heber, seven.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-14/" title="1 Chronicles 5:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 These *are* the children of Abihail the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-15/" title="1 Chronicles 5:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of the house of their fathers.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-16/" title="1 Chronicles 5:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And they dwelt in Gilead in Bashan, and in her towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon, upon their borders.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-17/" title="1 Chronicles 5:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-18/" title="1 Chronicles 5:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 The sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, and to shoot with bow, and skilful in war, *were* four and forty thousand seven hundred and threescore, that went out to the war.
<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-19/" title="1 Chronicles 5:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 And they made war with the Hagarites, with Jetur, and Nephish, and Nodab.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-20/" title="1 Chronicles 5:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 And they were helped against them, and the Hagarites were delivered into their hand, and all that *were* with them: for they cried to God in the battle, and he was intreated of them; because they put their trust in him.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-21/" title="1 Chronicles 5:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 And they took away their cattle; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand, and of asses two thousand, and of men an hundred thousand.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-22/" title="1 Chronicles 5:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 For there fell down many slain, because the war *was* of God. And they dwelt in their steads until the captivity.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-23/" title="1 Chronicles 5:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 And the children of the half tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land: they increased from Bashan unto Baalhermon and Senir, and unto mount Hermon.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-24/" title="1 Chronicles 5:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 And these *were* the heads of the house of their fathers, even Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, and Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valour, famous men, *and* heads of the house of their fathers.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-25/" title="1 Chronicles 5:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 And they transgressed against the God of their fathers, and went a whoring after the gods of the people of the land, whom God destroyed before them.

<a href="../1-Chronicles-5-26/" title="1 Chronicles 5:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 And the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria, and he carried them away, even the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, and brought them unto Halah, and Habor, and Hara, and to the river Gozan, unto this day.
